paper.title: Quantile Regression Based Enhanced Indexing with Portfolio Rebalancing
paper.abstract: In this article, an enhanced indexing (EI) model is put forward for portfolio selection to optimize a specific quantile of the return distribution of the benchmark index + alpha return combined with the conditional value at risk to control the downside risk in the portfolio. Constraints on short-selling and portfolio rebalancing with the transaction and holding costs are built in the models as a means of integrating real-life functionalities. The proposed models are linear or mixed integer linear programs. The out-of-sample performance comparison of the proposed model without short-selling with the benchmark index and an existing quantile based EI model on the data sets of several markets across the globe exhibit higher average returns and mean-risk ratios like Sharpe ratio and STARR, thus fulfilling the objective of EI. We also study the out-of-sample performance of our model with short-selling during financial meltdown periods.

domain_result.justification: 该论文提出了一种增强指数化（EI）模型用于投资组合选择，旨在优化基准指数回报分布的特定分位数，并结合条件风险价值（CVaR）来控制投资组合的下行风险。此外，论文还考虑了卖空和投资组合再平衡等现实功能，并通过全球多个市场的数据集进行了样本外性能比较。这些内容明确表明该论文的核心技术应用于投资组合管理和金融风险管理领域。
